properties.headline: SMH Half Marathon - SYDNEY CBD, THE ROCKS, BARANGAROO & PYRMONT Macquarie St, Cahill Expressway Overpass, Western Distributor, Pirrama Rd
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed and light rail services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall until around 9am. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Major roads in the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont will start closing from 3.30am for the SMH Half Marathon with up to 13,000 participants. The course will travel from Hyde Park to Pyrmont and return via the Harbour Foreshore, Western Distributor and Cahill Expressway Overpass.

The Sydney Harbour Bridge remains open however motorists should consider using the Sydney Harbour Tunnel to avoid delays in the CBD. There will be no direct access between the Western Distributor and Sydney Harbour Bridge in either direction. Access to the Anzac Bridge from the city is via the Druitt St on-ramp. Access to the Harbour Bridge from the city is via Kent St and Clarence St. 

KEY ROAD CLOSURES:

  • Hyde Park from 2am to 1pm: Park St between College St and Elizabeth St (event finish line).
  • Macquarie St from 3.30am to 11.30am: Macquarie St between St James Rd and Hunter St (event start line). 
  • Circular Quay & The Rocks from 4.30am to 9am: roads north of Bent St including Bridge St, Alfred St, Pitt St, Young St, Loftus St, Macquarie St and George St / Hickson Rd north of Grosvenor St. Motorists travelling southbound on York St can access the Eastern Distributor via Liverpool and William Streets.
  • Western Distributor from 4am to 11am: the Western Distributor from Pyrmont to the CBD including Fig St, Pyrmont St and Market St on-ramps and King St and Harris St off-ramps will be closed. Motorists travelling citybound on the Anzac Bridge will be detoured via the Bathurst St off-ramp. Access to the Anzac Bridge from the CBD is via the Druitt St on-ramp or from Sydney Harbour Bridge and Harbour St.
  • Cahill Expressway from 4am to 11.30am: The Cahill Expressway Circular Quay Overpass will be closed. Motorists travelling southbound to the Eastern Suburbs should use the Sydney Harbour Tunnel.
  • Pyrmont from 4.30am to 11am: Pirrama Rd, Bowman St, Union St, Murray St, Darling Drive and surrounding local roads. Motorists travelling to the city or the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be diverted via Harris St and local roads in Ultimo and Haymarket.
  • Millers Point & Barangaroo from 4.30am to 11am: Sussex St, Hickson Rd, Kent St, Pottinger St, Windmill St and Watson Rd. Access to the Rocks is maintained via York St, Lang St and Harrington St.
  • Sydney CBD from 4.30am to 11.30am: sections of Macquarie St, Bridge St, Bent St, College St, Hunter St and St James Rd. Access the Eastern Distributor via Liverpool and William Streets. Motorists can cross Macquarie St at Shakespeare Pl / Bent St before 6am and after 11am.
  • The Domain from 4.30am to 12pm: Art Gallery Rd and Mrs Macquaries Rd.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect between 1.30am and 12:30pm on various roads throughout the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopened after infrastructure removal and cleaning.  

SYDNEY CBD

From 2:00AM to 1:00PM

  • Park St between Elizabeth St and College St    

From 3:30AM to 11:30AM

  • Macquarie St between Hunter St and St James Rd    

WESTERN DISTRIBUTOR From 4:00AM to 11:00AM

  • Fig St on ramp to City and Sydney Harbour Bridge
  • Harbour St on ramp to Anzac Bridge
  • Harris St off ramp to Darling Harbour
  • King St off ramp to City North
  • Market St on ramp to Darling Harbour and Anzac Bridge
  • Pyrmont St on ramp to City and Sydney Harbour Bridge  

Western Distributor eastbound traffic will be diverted to Bathurst St off ramp:

  • Access to Sydney Harbour Bridge via Clarence St or Harbour St. Clarence St is recommended as Harbour St northbound will be reduced to one lane to accommodate the Wheat Rd contra-flow.

Access to CBD North via Kent Sydney Harbour Bridge southbound traffic to the Western Distributor will be diverted to Harbour St: Access to Western Distributor – left Bathurst St, left Kent St, left Druitt St Access to Pyrmont and Ultimo – right Pier St  

PYRMONT / ULTIMO

From 4:00AM to 11:00AM

  • Allen St 1 between Harris St and Pyrmont St  
  • Pyrmont St 2 between Pyrmont Bridge Rd and Quarry St

Notes:

1 Managed local access to Gipps St, Experiment St and the Harris St car park only available from Harris St southbound, then left into Allen St.

2 Pyrmont St access arrangements for residential underground car parks: 4am – 6am exit only. 6am to 9.15am – no entry or exit. 9.15am – 11am - exit only.

3 Local access to Pyrmont St south of Quarry St will be via traffic control at Harris St and Quarry St. Access is via Harris St southbound then left into Quarry St only.  

CAHILL EXPRESSWAY / SYDNEY HARBOUR BRIDGE From 4:00AM to 11:30AM

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Clearways will be in affect on both sides of the road unless stated otherwise. Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
KING ST WHARF, COCKLE BAY WHARF & BARANGAROO

While Hickson Rd is closed access to King St Wharf, Barangaroo South and Crown Sydney will be restricted to tenants/residents only and managed under traffic control. We strongly advise motorists to avoid non-essential travel to or from these precincts between 5am and 10am as delays are expected.

  • Before 6am and after 10am: access via Erskine St
  • From 6am to 10am: entry to the precinct will be managed at the northern end of Wheat Rd between the Western Distributor and King St (access from Harbour St). Exit will be managed via Wheat Rd under two-way traffic control, only for vehicles 7m and under (21 seat minibuses and smaller)

Vehicles over 7metres will be unable to use the managed exit and will need to remain within the precinct until Erskine St reopens. Before 6am and after 10am entry and exit is maintained via Erskine St at Kent St.

THE ROCKS / MILLERS POINT

From 9am to 11am, local access will be managed under traffic control at the Kent St and Erskine St intersection for access to properties on Kent St as far north as High St. Managed access from High St to Dalgety Rd, Bettington St, and Barangaroo Car Park

Prior to 9am there will be no managed vehicle access to this area due to the runners on course. Access to and from The Rocks & Dawes Point is maintained throughout the event via Lang St and Harrington St.

Vehicles are not permitted to exit a driveway or carpark onto a closed road. If you require access to your vehicle during the event you will need to relocate it outside the closure footprint prior to the road closures. Once roads are closed no vehicle movements will be permitted until the roads have safely reopened.

CIRCULAR QUAY

Circular Quay Roads closed between 4:30am and 9:00am, traffic control will manage vehicles exiting from properties at the times and locations below.

  • From 4:30am to 6:00am: exit only via Phillip St southbound and exit only via Pitt St
  • From 6:00am to 8:30am: no exit
  • From 8:30am to 9:00am: exit via Phillip St southbound if safe to allow

SYDNEY CBD

Sydney Hospital/Hospital Road

Between 4:30am and 11:30am access to Hospital Rd and Sydney Hospital is via Shakespeare Pl under two-way traffic control

PYRMONT

Access into Pyrmont will be available via Pier Street and Harris Street or via the Pyrmont Bridge Road (Fish Market) off-ramp and Allen Street off-ramp from the Western Distributor. We strongly advise to delay any non-essential travel through the area until roads have reopened

  • Pyrmont St south of Quarry St between 4am and 11am: access via Harris St southbound then left Quarry St, right Pyrmont St. Exit the same way under two-way traffic control.
  • Residential access to Gipps St and Experiment St between 4am and 11am: access via Harris St southbound then left into Allen St

Murray St between Union St and Pyrmont St

  • between 4:30am and 11am: enter via Darling Dr
  • between 4:30am and 9:15am: exit via Darling Dr

Pyrmont St residential car park driveways between Bunn Ln and Allen St: no access between 6am and 9:15am
arrangementElements.title: Local access arrangements

arrangementElements.html:
CYCLEWAY CLOSURES

SYDNEY CBD - From 4:30AM to 9:00AM

  • Pitt St between Alfred St and Bridge St    

SYDNEY CBD / PYRMONT - From 4:30AM to 11:00AM

  • King St between Kent St and Sussex St  
  • Union St between Edward St and Murray St    

CYCLIST DETOURS

From 6:45AM to 10:15AM  

Cycling detours will be in place between Kent St cycleway and Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway, via Observatory Hill. Marshals will direct cyclists across Upper Fort St in both directions when safe gaps between runners present. Alternatively, cyclists can travel between Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway and Sydney CBD via Cumberland St.

  • To Sydney Harbour Bridge from Kent Street cycleway - turn right Kent St on ramp shared path,  cycling/pedestrian bridge to Upper Fort St, left Sydney Observatory access road, right Observatory Hill shared path, proceed to Upper Fort St managed bicycle crossing and marshal
  • To Kent Street from Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway - proceed to Upper Fort St managed bicycle crossing and marshal, proceed via Observatory Hill shared path, turn left onto Sydney Observatory access road, right to the cycling/pedestrian bridge and Kent St on ramp shared path, proceed to Kent Street cycleway
arrangementElements.title: Cycleway closures and detours

roads.suburb: Sydney CBD, The Rocks, Barangaroo & Pyrmont

properties.headline: NRL - WOOLOOWARE Captain Cook Drive at PointsBet Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include return travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Warriors at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 4:05pm and full-time around 6pm. 

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: A-League - LEUMEAH Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive approaching Campbelltown Sports Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick off from 4.05pm, full time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.headline: Hawkesbury Show - CLARENDON Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Road, The Northern Road, Richmond Road approaching Hawkesbury Showground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip by public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
The 2022 Hawkesbury Show will be held at Hawkesbury Showground in Clarendon from Friday to Sunday. The show runs from 9am to 11pm on Friday and Saturday and until 5pm on Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Rd, The Northern Rd, and Richmond Rd approaching the Precinct as families travel to the showground over the weekend.

Very heavy traffic is expected in Clarendon and surrounding suburbs approaching the showground. Attendees travelling to the show are advised to use public transport where possible.

roads.mainStreet: Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Road, The Northern Road, Richmond Road

properties.headline: Special events - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Sydney Showground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Olympic Park will be busy with events taking place in the precinct across the weekend: 

  • Meatstock Music and BBQ Festival at Sydney Showground from 5pm on Friday, 11am Saturday and 10am Sunday.
  • Africultures Festival at Cathy Freeman Park on Saturday from 10am, finishing around 6pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as attendees travel to the events. Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park.

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space, available by 11.59pm the night before.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: AFL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21  SHUTTLES EP23.pdf

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park game day clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V005_04MAY22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park game day clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Essendon Bombers at the SCG. First bounce from 7:25pm and full-time approx. 10:05pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before kick off and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park via Moore Park Road and the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit for EP2 and Randwick exit for EP3.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Chalmers St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:

properties.headline: Indoor music festival - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Sydney Showground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
MaRLo ALTITUDE at Sydney Showground from 7pm, finishing around midnight.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd.

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space, available by 11.59pm the night before.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: Super Rugby - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Hurricanes at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 7:50pm, full time at approx. 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Super Rugby - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Fijian Drua v Moana Pasifika at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 2:35pm and full-time around 4:20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: AFL - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching GIANTS Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v Carlton at GIANTS Stadium, Olympic Park. First bounce from 3:20pm, finishing approx. 5:50pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic may be heavier than usual on key roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 23:59 Sat 14 May).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: Special event - CABRAMATTA Arthur Street at Park Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Cabramatta Culinary Festival, held in the Cabramatta Town Centre on Saturday 14 May from 11am until late.

From 4am until midnight sections of Park Rd and Arthur St will be closed to accommodate the event. Dutton lane will also be closed from 6am until 9pm. 

The Arthur St car park will also close from 8pm Friday 13 May until midnight Saturday 14 May.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads around the the event site. Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - FAIRLIGHT Sydney Rd at Woods Parade
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Street Party event will be held at Fairlight Village on Saturday from 10am to 6pm

Changed traffic conditions will be in place with a westbound lane closure on Sydney Rd at Woods Pde and speed limit reduction to 40km/h through the area from 8am to 8pm.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 6am to 8pm on Hilltop Cres between Sydney Rd and Woods Pde (both sides) and Sydney Rd between Hilltop Cres and Woods Pde (western side).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: Street Festival - BRIGHTON-LE-SANDS Bay Street between The Grand Parade AND Moate Avenue
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and parking restrictions will be in effect for the Streets Alive festival to be held in Brighton-Le-Sands from 9am to 10pm on Saturday and Sunday.

Closures will be in place on Bay St between The Grand Pde and Moate Ave and on Trafalgar St between The Boulevarde and Bay St from 4am Saturday 14 May until 2am Monday 16 May.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will also be in effect on sections of Bay St and Trafalgar St from 4am Saturday 14 May until 2am Monday 16 May.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:

properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - DEE WHY The Strand between Oaks Avenue AND Dee Why Parade
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Street Party event will be held at Dee Why on Sunday from 10am to 6pm

The Strand will be closed between Oaks Ave and Dee Why Pde from 8am to 8pm.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 6am to 8pm on The Strand between Oaks Ave and Dee Why Pde (western side).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: NBL - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Qudos Bank Arena
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v Tasmania Jackjumpers Grand Final Game 3 at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip off at 7:35pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - HARRIS PARK Wigram Street between Ada Street AND Marion Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Street Party event will be held at Harris Park on Saturday from 12pm to 8pm

Wigram St will be closed between Ada St and Marion St from 8am to midnight.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will also be in effect from 6am to 10pm on both sides of Wigram St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: Boxing match - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Chatham Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Boxing match Gallen v Terzievski at Newcastle Entertainment Centre from 6:30pm and finishes around 11pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as attendees travel to and from the Entertainment Centre. The right hand turn from Griffiths Rd into the Entertainment Centre may be restricted during the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Expo - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Chatham Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Hunter Disability Expo at Newcastle Entertainment Centre from 10am to 3pm on Friday and Saturday.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as attendees travel to and from the Entertainment Centre. The right hand turn from Griffiths Rd into the Entertainment Centre may be restricted during the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Street Parade - SCONE Kelly Street between Kingdon Street AND St Aubins Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Scone Horse Parade will be taking place along along Kelly Street from 10:45am.

To accommodate the event Kelly St between Kingdon St and St Aubins St will be closed in both directions from 9:30am until 1pm. 

Surrounding local roads will also be closed including sections of Guernsey St and Liverpool St. 

Motorists will be detoured via Main St and Susan St. 

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic controllers and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: A-League - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Newcastle Jets. Kick-off from 7:45pm and full-time approx. 9:45pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed from 5:30pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St and will reopen after the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: Music Festival - BERRY Princes Highway and Queen Street approaching Berry Showground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Big Country Festival is taking place at Berry Showground from 10:30am until 11pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual along the Princes Hwy approaching the off-ramp to Queen St, Kangaroo Valley Rd, Coolangatta Rd and other local roads in Berry as crowds arrive and leave the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: A-League - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Melbourne Victory at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off from 7:45pm and full-time approx. 9:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of kick-off including Jubilee Avenue, Park Street and English Street. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: NRL - BROOKVALE Pittwater Road at Brookvale Oval
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v West Tigers at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Kick off from 3pm, full-time around 5pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time as parking will be in high demand and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Cycle Ride - GRAFTON TO INVERELL Gwydir Highway
properties.otherAdvice:
Cyclists will take part in the Grafton to Inverell Cycle Classic on Saturday 7 May, starting from Prince St in Grafton and finishing on Vivian St in Inverell. The race will commence at 7:15am and the last riders are expected to reach Inverell by 5pm.

The Gwydir Highway between Tindal Road (15km west of Grafton) and Bald Nob Road (25km east of Glen Innes) will be closed westbound from 7.15am to 1.30pm, and closed eastbound from 5.15am to 1.30pm. 

The intersections of the Gwydir Highway at Dodds Lane and Elsmore Road will be under traffic control during the event. 

Motorists are advised to exercise caution, allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic control on site.

Motorists should be aware of the groups of cyclists as they share roads each day. Motorists are also reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

properties.headline: Triathlon - PORT STEPHENS Gan Gan Rd at Frost Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
The Port Stephens Triathlon is taking place at One Mile Beach from 6:45am until 1pm. 

Road closures will be in place for the event from 6am until 1pm on sections of Gan Gan Rd, Frost Rd, Hannah Pde, Eucalyptus Dr, Melaleuca Dr and Casuarina Cl. Resident access will be maintained during the closures when there are safe breaks between cyclists. Motorists can access the area from Gan Gan Rd at Anna Bay. 

Nelson Bay Rd may be busier than usual. Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers.

properties.headline: AFL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park game day clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V005_04MAY22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park game day clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Gold Coast Suns at the SCG. First bounce from 1:45pm and full-time approx. 4:25pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 10:45am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park via Moore Park Road and the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit for EP2 and Randwick exit for EP3.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am until 7pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Chalmers St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 11AM TO 7PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side) 

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.

properties.headline: Police Operation - SYDNEY CBD Castlereagh Street, Park Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses and light rail services may experience delays. Check service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place in the Sydney CBD between 3.15pm and 4pm for a planned Police Operation protest march.

Closures will be in place along sections of Castlereagh St and Park St from Martin Place to Town Hall.

Motorists should avoid the area during this time or expect delays and follow the directions of NSW Police on site.

webLinks.linkText: Mother's Day Classic fun run & walk 2022

properties.headline: Mother's Day Classic fun run - SYDNEY CBD Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd to The Domain
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Mother's Day Classic - Road closures & Clearways map 2022
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Mother's Day Classic - Road closures & Clearways map 2022

properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of participants will take part in 7.5km and 4.8km Mother’s Day Classic fun run and walk events starting from 7:30am in The Domain. Participants will travel along sections of Macquarie St, College St then Art Gallery Rd and Mrs Macquarie's Rd to finish back in The Domain by approximately 12pm.

ROAD CLOSURES

  • *CLOSED* 5am to 12pm - Art Gallery Rd/ Mrs Macquarie's Rd from Prince Albert Rd and Hospital Rd. Access to Hospital Rd is via Shakespeare Place only in both directions.

Clearways are in effect on sections of Prince Albert Rd and Hospital Rd from 5am to 12pm midday.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Mother’s Day is traditionally one of the busiest days on the roads. Wherever you are travelling, expect it to take longer than usual and factor in extra travel time.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

Clearways are in effect on both sides unless specified otherwise.

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 5AM TO 10AM

  • College Street between Park Street and Prince Albert Road        
  • Hunter Street between Macquarie Street and Elizabeth Street 
  • Macquarie Street between St James Road and Bent Street         
  • St James Road between Elizabeth Street and Prince Albert Road              
  • Prince Albert Road between St James Road and St Mary's Rd          
  • St Mary’s Road between Prince Albert Road and Sir John Young Cres

FROM 5AM TO 12PM MIDDAY

  • Hospital Road between Prince Albert Road and Sydney Hospital Pedestrian Crossing      
  • Prince Albert Road between St Mary’s Road and Hospital Road

Notes:
